definitions.definition: To fail to properly distinguish or keep separate (things); to mistakenly treat (them) as equivalent.
examples: “Bacon was Lord Chancellor of England and the first European to experiment with gunpowder.” — “No, you are conflating Francis Bacon and Roger Bacon.”

definitions.definition: To deliberately draw a false equivalence or association, typically in a tacit or implicit manner as propaganda and/or an intentional distortion or misrepresentation of the subject matter.

secondary_definitions: ( by extension ) To fail to properly distinguish or keep separate (things); to mistakenly treat (them) as equivalent.

( by extension ) To deliberately draw a false equivalence or association, typically in a tacit or implicit manner as propaganda and/or an intentional distortion or misrepresentation of the subject matter.
